meanings.definition: Having the most prominent or pronounced beak
meanings.sent1: The pelican had the beakiest bill among all the birds in the pond.
meanings.sent2: The toucan's beakiest feature is what makes it easily recognizable.
meanings.sent3: The beakiest parrot in the pet store kept trying to mimic the customers' conversations.
meanings.sent4: Her beakiest smile revealed her excitement for the upcoming bird-watching trip.
meanings.sent5: The beakiest eagle in the sky soared gracefully above the treetops.

meanings.sent1: Out of all the birds, the parrot was the beakiest with its colorful beak.
meanings.sent2: The beakiest bird in the forest was the woodpecker, known for its strong beak.
meanings.sent3: The beakiest penguin in the zoo waddled around proudly, showing off its distinctive feature.
meanings.sent4: Her beakiest hat at the party was adorned with feathers and sparkles, making her stand out.
meanings.sent5: The beakiest sculpture in the art exhibit captured the essence of bird beauty perfectly.
